_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A.  Introduction

    Ag Service Inc. is a supplier and manufacturer of fertilizer and other inputs to local agricultural growers and    retail fertilizer business. Bulk Anhydrous Ammonia is received via transport trucks and reacted with different types of acids to make liquid fertilizer for the eventual sale to farmers.  This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractors due to the RMP covered process.  There have been no accidents in the past 5 years.  

B.  Accident Release Prevention Policies and Program

    This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with state anhydrous ammonia regulations.  Training is provided for each new hire and retraining for all employees every three years for employees working at the Hesston facility are required by OSHA.  The anhydrous ammonia tank and associated equipment are inspected annually following recommended industry and engineering frequencies.  Pressurized tank and plumbing are tested according to the standards for the pressure vessel testing.  Ag Service Inc. has implemented a comprehensive program at its facility designed to safeguard the environment, its workers and the surrounding communities.  The layers of protection are the numerous prevention mechanisms implemented at the company's fertilizer storage facility to help manage the risks inherent in handling anhydrous ammonia.  The key safety features are listed below.  

     The facility conducts comprehensive reviews to insure that hazards associated with the processes are identified and controlled efficiently.  These reviews are conducted in accordance with the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard.  One of these reviews is a Process Hazards Analysis (PHA) which is designed to identify all failure scenarios that could lead to a significant exposure of ammonia to workers, the public, or environment. The review is undertaken by a team of quali

fied personnel with expertise in engineering and process operations and is revalidated every five years.  Any findings related to the PHA are addressed in a timely manner.

Critical operating conditions are monitored through instrumentation. Digital pressure gauges alert personnel with alarms.

C.   Emergency Response Policies and Programs

     Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency response policies and procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings.  This facility has an Emergency Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency response practices and procedures.  The Emergency Plan for this facility is reviewed and updated on an annual basis as part of a comprehensive review process.  The Emergency Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the response procedures to an emergency.  The procedures provided in the Emergency Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the even of an emergency.  The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished a copy of the Emergency Plan for this facility and invited for a tour on a regular basis.

D.   Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario

     This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-case scenario, however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.

E.   Five Year Accident History

     This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its employees as a result of the RMP cover process.  In addition, there have been no accidents resulting in releases of anhydrous ammonia with off-site consequences during the entire operation period.  Extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.

F.   Planned Changes to Improve Safety

     Management of this company and facility continuously looks for ways to enhance the safety of this

location.   Monthly safety inspections are conducted which result in corrective actions.  Annual equipment inspections are also conducted, and detailed environmental health and safety audits are conducted at least every three years.

G.  Summary

    The employees of this company are extremely proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety.  We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our safe facility environment for the public, customers, and our employees for years to come.
